intro: Didymopanax undulatus, commonly known as the wavy-leaf sycoglossum, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with wavy margins. The plant typically grows as an understory tree in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in umbels, and are followed by yellowish fruits.
